header.title: httpd_util

erlref.modulesummary: Miscellaneous utility functions to be used when implementing Erlang Web server API modules.

description.p: This module provides the Erlang Web Server API module programmer with miscellaneous utility functions.

func.name: convert_request_date(DateString) -> ErlDate|bad_date
func.fsummary: Convert The the date to the Erlang date format.

type.v: Year = Month = Date = Hour = Min = Sec = integer()

desc.p: convert_request_date/1 converts DateString to the Erlang date format. DateString must be in one of the three date formats that is defined in the RFC 2616.

func.name: create_etag(FileInfo) -> Etag
func.fsummary: Calculates the Etag for a file.

desc.p: create_etag/1 calculates the Etag for a file, from its size and time for last modification. fileinfo is a record defined in kernel/include/file.hrl

func.name: decode_hex(HexValue) -> DecValue
func.fsummary: Convert a hex value into its decimal equivalent.

desc.p: Converts the hexadecimal value HexValue into its decimal equivalent (DecValue).

func.name: day(NthDayOfWeek) -> DayOfWeek
func.fsummary: Convert the day of the week (integer [1-7]) to an abbreviated string.

desc.p: day/1 converts the day of the week (NthDayOfWeek) as an integer (1-7) to an abbreviated string, that is:

func.name: flatlength(NestedList) -> Size
func.fsummary: Compute the size of a possibly nested list.

desc.p: flatlength/1 computes the size of the possibly nested list NestedList. Which may contain binaries.

func.name: hexlist_to_integer(HexString) -> Number
func.fsummary: Convert a hexadecimal string to an integer.

desc.p: hexlist_to_integer Convert the Hexadecimal value of HexString to an integer.

func.name: integer_to_hexlist(Number) -> HexString
func.fsummary: Convert an integer to a hexadecimal string.

desc.p: integer_to_hexlist/1 Returns a string that represents the Number in a Hexadecimal form.

func.name: lookup(ETSTable,Key) -> Result
lookup(ETSTable,Key,Undefined) -> Result
func.fsummary: Extract the first value associated with a key in an ETS table.

desc.p: lookup extracts {Key,Value} tuples from ETSTable and returns the Value associated with Key. If ETSTable is of type bag only the first Value associated with Key is returned. lookup/2 returns undefined and lookup/3 returns Undefined if no Value is found.

func.name: lookup_mime(ConfigDB,Suffix)
lookup_mime(ConfigDB,Suffix,Undefined) -> MimeType
func.fsummary: Return the mime type associated with a specific file suffix.

desc.p: lookup_mime returns the mime type associated with a specific file suffix as specified in the mime.types file (located in the config directory).

func.name: lookup_mime_default(ConfigDB,Suffix)
lookup_mime_default(ConfigDB,Suffix,Undefined) -> MimeType
func.fsummary: Return the mime type associated with a specific file suffix or the value of the DefaultType.

desc.p: lookup_mime_default returns the mime type associated with a specific file suffix as specified in the mime.types file (located in the config directory). If no appropriate association can be found the value of DefaultType is returned.

func.name: message(StatusCode,PhraseArgs,ConfigDB) -> Message
func.fsummary: Return an informative HTTP 1.1 status string in HTML.

desc.p: message/3 returns an informative HTTP 1.1 status string in HTML. Each StatusCode requires a specific PhraseArgs:

taglist.item: string(): A URL pointing at the new document position.
string(): A Request-URI as described in RFC 2616.
{Method,RequestURI,HTTPVersion}: The HTTP Method, Request-URI and HTTP-Version as defined in RFC 2616.
string(): A string describing why the service was unavailable.

func.name: month(NthMonth) -> Month
func.fsummary: Convert the month as an integer (1-12) to an abbreviated string.

desc.p: month/1 converts the month NthMonth as an integer (1-12) to an abbreviated string, that is:

func.name: multi_lookup(ETSTable,Key) -> Result
func.fsummary: Extract the values associated with a key in a ETS table.

desc.p: multi_lookup extracts all {Key,Value} tuples from an ETSTable and returns allValues associated with the Key in a list.

func.name: reason_phrase(StatusCode) -> Description
func.fsummary: Return the description of an HTTP 1.1 status code.

desc.p: reason_phrase returns the Description of an HTTP 1.1 StatusCode, for example 200 is "OK" and 201 is "Created". Read RFC 2616 for further information.

func.name: rfc1123_date() -> RFC1123Date
rfc1123_date({{YYYY,MM,DD},{Hour,Min,Sec}}) -> RFC1123Date
func.fsummary: Return the current date in RFC 1123 format.

type.v: YYYY = MM = DD = Hour = Min = Sec = integer()

desc.p: rfc1123_date/0 returns the current date in RFC 1123 format. rfc_date/1 converts the date in the Erlang format to the RFC 1123 date format.

func.name: split(String,RegExp,N) -> SplitRes
func.fsummary: Split a string in N chunks using a regular expression.

desc.p: split/3 splits the String in N chunks using the RegExp. split/3 is is equivalent to regexp:split/2 with one exception, that is N defines the number of maximum number of fields in the FieldList.

func.name: split_script_path(RequestLine) -> Splitted
func.fsummary: Split a RequestLinein a file reference to an executable and aQueryStringor a PathInfostring.

desc.p: split_script_path/1 is equivalent to split_path/1 with one exception. If the longest possible path is not a regular, accessible and executable file not_a_script is returned.

func.name: split_path(RequestLine) -> {Path,QueryStringOrPathInfo}
func.fsummary: Split a RequestLinein a file reference and a QueryStringor aPathInfostring.

desc.p: split_path/1 splits the RequestLine in a file reference (Path) and a QueryString or a PathInfo string as specified in RFC 2616. A QueryString is isolated from the Path with a question mark (?) and PathInfo with a slash (/). In the case of a QueryString, everything before the ? is a Path and everything after a QueryString. In the case of a PathInfo the RequestLine is scanned from left-to-right on the hunt for longest possible Path being a file or a directory. Everything after the longest possible Path, isolated with a /, is regarded as PathInfo. The resulting Path is decoded using decode_hex/1 before delivery.

func.name: strip(String) -> Stripped
func.fsummary: Returns String where the leading and trailing space and tabs has been removed.

desc.p: strip/1 removes any leading or trailing linear white space from the string. Linear white space should be read as horizontal tab or space.

func.name: suffix(FileName) -> Suffix
func.fsummary: Extract the file suffix from a given filename.

desc.p: suffix/1 is equivalent to filename:extension/1 with one exception, that is Suffix is returned without a leading dot (.).
